propositions.text: The protagonist, Lin Xiaoyue, is a modern woman who has transmigrated.
She has transmigrated due to an accident into a completely unfamiliar place.
She has become the most beloved youngest daughter of the current Emperor.
She is also the fiancée of the Prince.
The protagonist is not the original Lin Xiaoyue, but a thousand-year-old fox spirit.
The fox spirit possessed the body of the Prince's fiancée due to an accident.
The protagonist feels annoyed and uncomfortable by the gossip and rumors.
She has a white fox companion named Xiaobai.
She confides in Xiaobai about her troubles and concerns, such as whether she can return to her original form.
She decides to visit the Prince at his residence, 'Qinxin Garden'.
She feels an inexplicable urge to see him.
She is curious about the Prince's appearance.
Upon arriving at 'Qinxin Garden', she is addressed by a deep male voice.
She identifies herself as Lin Xiaoyue.
The Prince, in a purple-gold robe, questions her visit with a playful yet sharp demeanor.
He has handsome features and a hint of playfulness in his eyes.
The protagonist experiences shyness and a racing heart in the Prince's presence.
The Prince notices her blushing and teases her about it.
She claims to be feeling hot as an excuse.
The Prince proposes playing a game of chess, suggesting he wants to test her patience.
The protagonist admits she doesn't know how to play chess well.
The Prince offers to teach her, implying that this is his reason for inviting her.
She feels a mixture of anticipation and apprehension about being taught by the Prince.

concepts.name: transmigration
concepts.context: The protagonist's journey from a modern world to another.

concepts.name: Prince
concepts.context: A key male character in the story.

concepts.name: chess
concepts.context: A game proposed by the Prince.

concepts.name: shyness
concepts.context: The protagonist's emotional reaction to the Prince.

hierarchy.structure: The document begins with an introduction to the protagonist's predicament, followed by her internal reflections and decision to seek out the Prince, culminating in their initial encounter and dialogue.
